Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
INVOCATION - Reverend Pastor Frederick Crawford Union Grove Missionary Baptist Church located at 1488 Hoe Ave, Bronx, NY 10460.

Motion to spread the Invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Salamanca.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by Reverend Pastor Frederick Crawford Union Grove Missionary Baptist Church  located at 1488 Hoe Avenue, Bronx, N.Y. 10460.

Council Member Salamanca moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: ADOPTION OF MINUTES - Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 28, 2019 be adopted as printed by Council Member Miller.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Miller moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of February 28, 2019 be adopted as printed.

Items.AgendaNote: MESSAGES & PAPERS FROM THE MAYOR - None

Report of the Committee on Civil and Human Rights
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON CIVIL AND HUMAN RIGHTS

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibition of drug testing for pre-employment hiring procedures
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Prohibition of drug testing for pre-employment hiring procedures

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Health
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON HEALTH

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring water tank inspectors to submit annual inspection reports directly to the department of health and mental hygiene
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring water tank inspectors to submit annual inspection reports directly to the department of health and mental hygiene.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to conduct periodic inspections of water tanks and to post the results online
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to conduct periodic inspections of water tanks and to post the results online.

Items.Title: A Local Law to the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of health and mental hygiene to review documentation of annual inspections of water tanks where harmful bacteria are found, and to post the results online
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of health and mental hygiene to review documentation of annual inspections of water tanks where harmful bacteria are found, and to post the results online.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to electronic reporting of water tank inspection and cleaning
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Electronic reporting of water tank inspection and cleaning.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to qualifications for persons conducting inspections and maintenance on drinking water tanks
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Qualifications for persons conducting inspections and maintenance on drinking water tanks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the repair of damaged water tanks
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Repair of damaged water tanks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the visual documentation of water tanks during inspections, to be submitted to the department of health and mental hygiene
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the visual documentation of water tanks during inspections, to be submitted to the department of health and mental hygiene.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutions
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a local community and media bill of rights addressing the issues that communities face during film and television production
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Creating a local community and media bill of rights addressing the issues that communities face during film and television production.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating a penalty for leaving a companion animal outside during inclement weather conditions and subjecting violators to the registration requirements of the Animal Abuse Registry
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Creating a penalty for leaving a companion animal outside during inclement weather conditions and subjecting violators to the registration requirements of the Animal Abuse Registry.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to retrieval of companion animals by an animal shelter after an eviction or order or judgment granting legal possession
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Retrieval of companion animals by an animal shelter after an eviction or order or judgment granting legal possession.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the New York City police department to report data regarding animal cruelty complaints
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the NYPD to report data regarding animal cruelty complaints.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the Mayor of New York City to permanently staff all Fire Department of New York (FDNY) engine companies with five firefighters and an officer at the outset of each tour.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Fire and Emergency Management
Items.MatterName: Permanently staff all FDNY engine companies with five firefighters and an officer at the outset of each tour.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the provision of tenant screening reports
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Provision of tenant screening reports.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to notifications pertaining to the expiration dates of affordable housing units
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Notifications pertaining to the expiration dates of affordable housing units.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to requiring that sidewalk sheds are constructed using an alternative to cross-braced scaffolds to provide greater sidewalk access and safety
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring that sidewalk sheds are constructed using an alternative to cross-braced scaffolds to provide greater sidewalk access and safety.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the welfare of shelter animals
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Welfare of shelter animals.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to requiring community board members to use government-issued e-mail addresses to conduct community board business
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Technology
Items.MatterName: Requiring community board members to use government-issued e-mail addresses to conduct community board business.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Department of Education to provide one full-time school psychologist for every 500-700 students.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE to provide one full-time school psychologist for every 500-700 students.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the penalties for businesses selling synthetic drugs and the landlords of such businesses
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Increasing the penalties for businesses selling synthetic drugs and the landlords of such businesses.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to power-operated and power-assisted doors
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Power-operated and power-assisted doors.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city building code, in relation to requiring that vents in elevator hoistway enclosures be closed to prevent air leakage
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Requiring that vents in elevator hoistway enclosures be closed to prevent air leakage.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to increasing the daily fee for after-hours work variances
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings
Items.MatterName: Increasing the daily fee for after-hours work variances.

Items.Title: Resolution commending the New York State Office of Court Administration for promulgating rules that require a judicial warrant for any civil arrest in a New York State court and calling on the State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, the “Protect Our Courts Act” (A.2176 / S.425), in order to further protect certain interested parties or people from civil arrest while going to, remaining at, or returning from the place of such court proceeding.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Immigration
Items.MatterName: Protect Our Courts Act (A.2176 / S.425)

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass, and the Governor to sign, S.1343B/A.5493, which would reform revocation presumptive release, parole, conditional release, and post-release supervision.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.MatterName: Reform revocation presumptive release, parole, conditional release, and post-release supervision. (S.1343B/A.5493)

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to restricting the parking of mobile homes and trailers near schools and parks
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Restricting the parking of mobile homes and trailers near schools and parks.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to creating borough-based traffic request response teams
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Creating borough-based traffic request response teams.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter and the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of a director of ferry operations
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: Establishment of a director of ferry operations.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Criminal Justice
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON CRIMINAL JUSTICE

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of correction to notify incarcerated individuals and their legal representatives when an incarcerated individual is held solely due to a bail amount of less than $10
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring the dept of correction to notify inmates, defense attorneys, and court personnel when an inmate is detained solely on a bail amount of one dollar.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to removing fees associated with bail payments
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Removing fees associated with credit card bail payments and in relation to allowing online bail payment to be made by direct deposit and electronic check.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the police department to report on arrests for false personation
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Requiring the police department to report on arrests for false personation.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to the disclosure of the industries of campaign contributors
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Disclosure of the industries of campaign contributors.

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Rules, Privileges & Elections
Items.AgendaNote: REPORT OF THE COMMITTEE ON RULES, PRIVILEGES AND ELECTIONS

Items.Title: Resolution to Amend the Rules of the Council, in relation adding Rule 2.45 to the Rules of the Council, modifying Rule 6.00, making certain changes to Chapter VII, Committees, and to Chapter XI, Rules of the Land Use Committee.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Resolution to amend the Rules of the Council in relation to procurement procedures, eliminating requirement that papers be submitted in quadruplicate, membership, title and formation of Standing Committee and Land Use, which would include the dissolution

There were 44 Council Members marked present at this Stated Meeting.
